questions.prompt: In BG 2.2, what does Krsna point out to sad Arjuna?
choices: His sword is too heavy
He is acting weak and sad even though he is a warrior
His clothes are torn
His horse is tired
questions.feedback: Krsna tells Arjuna that he is being weak and sad when he should be brave and strong.

questions.prompt: What does Krsna tell Arjuna to do in BG 2.3?
choices: Run away from the battle
Cry and feel sad
Stop being weak and stand up to face what needs to be done
Sit and do nothing
questions.feedback: Krsna tells Arjuna to give up being sad and weak, and to stand up and be strong.

questions.prompt: What does Arjuna do in BG 2.7?
choices: He tells Krsna to go away
He gets angry with Krsna
He asks Krsna to teach him what the right thing to do is
He ignores everything Krsna says
questions.feedback: Arjuna is confused and asks Krsna to teach him because he knows Krsna is wise.

questions.prompt: Are the things we see and experience permanent, or do they always change?
choices: They are always exactly the same
They change like seasons - sometimes happy, sometimes sad, and that is normal
They never change at all
Only bad things change
questions.feedback: Just like seasons come and go, our feelings and experiences change all the time. This is natural and happens to everyone.

questions.prompt: According to BG 2.13, what happens as we grow from young to old?
choices: We become a different person each time we grow
We stay exactly the same
Our body changes but we remain the same person inside
We are a new person every day
questions.feedback: Just as you grow from a baby to a child to a young person, your body changes but you are still the same you inside.

questions.prompt: Who is ready to do great things in life?
choices: Only people who never feel sad
Only people who never feel happy
People who stay calm even when things are happy or sad
People who run away from problems
questions.feedback: A person who can stay calm and not get too upset whether things are good or bad is strong and ready for great things.

questions.prompt: In BG 2.20, what does Krsna teach about the soul?
choices: The soul is born and dies with the body
The soul is not born and cannot die; it is eternal
The soul lives only for a few years
Only rich people have a soul
questions.feedback: Krsna teaches that the soul inside us never dies and was never born. It is eternal and forever.

questions.prompt: In BG 2.22, Krsna compares changing bodies to what?
choices: Eating food
Climbing a tree
Changing into new clothes and taking off old ones
Playing a game
questions.feedback: Just as we take off old clothes and put on new ones, the soul takes on a new body when the old one ends.

questions.prompt: What is special about doing the right duty without expecting rewards?
choices: It is bad and you should not do it
It is boring and a waste of time
It is good and keeps you free from bad results
It doesn't matter what you do
questions.feedback: When you do what is right without worrying about getting rewards, it keeps you happy and free from harm.

questions.prompt: What is Krsna's main message to Arjuna in Chapter 2?
choices: Always be sad and worried
The soul is eternal and cannot be hurt, so be brave and do what is right
Never do anything difficult
Only think about what makes you happy
questions.feedback: Krsna teaches that the soul is eternal and safe, so Arjuna should be brave, do his duty, and not be afraid.
